modules.description: This module provides functions to parse and generate XML data, including handling of character encodings and escaping special characters. It works with strings, Unicode characters, and XML-specific data structures like element trees. Concrete use cases include serializing configuration data to XML format and sanitizing input to ensure compliance with XML 1.0 specifications.

This module validates and processes strings according to UTF-8 encoding rules with XML-specific restrictions. It checks for compliance with RFC 3629 and XML 2.2 character sets, ensuring strings are valid for XML use. Functions include checking validity, validating with exceptions, and extracting the longest valid prefix. Use cases include sanitizing input for XML generation and ensuring UTF-8 compliance in XML-sensitive contexts.

This module provides a `validate` function that checks whether a given Unicode character is valid within UTF-8-encoded XML documents. It operates on `Uchar.t` values, ensuring they conform to both UTF-8 and XML character restrictions. It is used to sanitize input for XML generation or parsing, ensuring compliance with XML and UTF-8 standards.

This module provides functions for validating Unicode characters and strings according to UTF-8 and XML standards. It includes validators for checking XML-compatible Unicode characters, parsing and generating XML with proper encoding, and ensuring string validity for XML and UTF-8. Use cases include sanitizing input for XML serialization, validating configuration data, and extracting valid UTF-8 prefixes from strings.

This module validates Unicode characters and strings against UTF-8 and XML standards, offering functions to sanitize input for XML serialization, check string validity, and extract valid UTF-8 prefixes. It operates on character encodings and string data, ensuring compliance with XML and UTF-8 specifications. Concrete use cases include validating configuration data and preparing strings for XML processing.
